result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Szarfinski

defendant.name: Szarfinski, Richard J
defendant.address: 721 Oxford Ave C/O DHS, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt:
(3:32 PM cases 22CF640, 22CF745 called.) Defendant Richard J Szarfinski in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Richard J Szarfinski. Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Attorney Rivard advises has had discussions with the District Attorney Office and the defendant regarding a potential disposition.
Attorney Rivard advises the Doctor's opinion and requests to withdraw request for competency.
Attorney Rivard requests the Court find the defendant competent.
State does not object to Attorney Rivard's request for withdrawal for competency request and defers to Attorney Rivard for further comment. State notes the defendant has been taking medications and notes the doctor's notes indicate the defendant could be restored with medications.
Parties jointly request the Court find the defendant competent.
Attorney Rivard makes further argument for the Court to find the defendant is competent.
Court advises based on information presented in court, Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed.

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 22CF640, 22CF745 and Court accepts waivers.
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Information in 22CF640 will be filed by the State which will mirror the complaint.
Prior offense acknowledged for Repeater enhancer.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF640 Count 1: Throw or Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker as Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of 22CF640 Count 1.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court orders sentence as follows:
22CF640 Count 1:
45 days jail with 45 days credit. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any remaining charges including case 22CF745 are dismissed and read in.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, No Mail Receptacle, Unable to Forward
Competency hearing on August 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

(Cases called at 2:10 PM - 22CF640 and 22CF745)
Defendant Richard Szarfinski appears in custody with Attorney Francis Rivard.  Attorney Trenton Piltz appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense raises competency concerns and requests bond be converted from cash to a signature bond.  Court finds probable cause and orders a competency examination in both cases. State objects to modification of bond.  Court denies request to amend bond.  Branch 5 to schedule competency hearing.

(11:41 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Richard J Szarfinski appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared by video for Richard J Szarfinski.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
State requests $1,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Schmidt requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $250.00 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant updates address with the Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard J Szarfinski
Current: 721 Oxford Ave C/O DHS, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Eau Claire, WI
